Consider the following situation:

Everything is a tove, or a borogove, or a rath (exclusively), and there's at least one of each. Every borogove is uffish. If Bungo snicker-snacked Bungo, then Zindle is beamish only if not all borogoves are beamish. No raths will burble or every borogove is beamish.

Which, if any, of the following statements must be true in this situation?

1. Every rath snicker-snacked Zindle if and only if every borogove is beamish.
2. No borogoves are uffish.
3. Not all borogoves are uffish.
4. No borogoves are uffish if and only if not all borogoves are uffish.
5. Every rath snicker-snacked Zindle if and only if no borogoves are uffish.
6. Only borogoves are uffish.

Everything is a tove, or a borogove, or a rath (exclusively), and there's at least one of each. If every tove is mimsy, then Rafin didn't galumph over Bungo only if not all toves gimbled.
